problem: A gasoline tank is $\frac{7}{8}$ full. After $12$ gallons have been used, it is half full. How many gallons does this tank hold when it is full?
explanation:
Let $x$ represent the number of gallons the tank holds when it is full. We know that the difference between $\frac{7}{8}$ full and $\frac{1}{2}$ full is 12 gallons, so we set up an equation and solve for $x$. \begin{align*}
12&=\frac{7}{8}x-\frac{1}{2}x\quad\Rightarrow\\
12&=\frac{3}{8}x\quad\Rightarrow\\
12\cdot\frac{8}{3}&=x\quad\Rightarrow\\
32&=x
\end{align*} The tank holds $\boxed{32}$ gallons when it is full.
